alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Oldham; Shelby (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 8:12PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Clark, east central Floyd, southern Oldham, northwestern Shelby, southwestern Henry and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Prospect to Glenview to Jeffersonville. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... St. Matthews, Prospect, Graymoor-Devondale, Windy Hills, Barbourmeade, Northfield, Green Spring, Spring Valley, Brownsboro Farm and Bancroft around 815 PM EDT. Lyndon, Anchorage, St. Regis Park, Worthington Hills, Beechwood Village, Coldstream, Rolling Hills, Woodlawn Park, Langdon Place and Plantation around 820 PM EDT. Jeffersontown, Middletown, Douglass Hills, Hurstbourne, Hurstbourne Acres, Bellemeade, Blue Ridge Manor, Houston Acres, Norwood and Wildwood around 825 PM EDT. La Grange and Woodland Hills around 830 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Shelbyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Louisville. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
